com.complexible.stardog.icv.api

Class AbstractICVConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.complexible.stardog.api.impl.DelegatingConnection
      • com.complexible.stardog.icv.api.AbstractICVConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, ICVConnection, ICValidator, AutoCloseable

    public abstract class AbstractICVConnection
extends com.complexible.stardog.api.impl.DelegatingConnection
implements ICVConnection

    Abstract base implementation for a SNARL API Connection which supports ICV. This handles the oracle/validation bits by creating the ICV queries and delegating them to the parent connection. Also handles IO bits for changing constraints, but otherwise leaves constraint manipulation to the implementing classes.

    Since:
    0.8
    Version:
    4.1
    Author:
    Michael Grove

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public final boolean isValid(Constraint... theConstraints)
                      throws StardogException
        Returns true if the given integrity constraints are violated in the database. If no constraints are given then all the current constraints in the database are used. This function is equivalent to calling ICValidator.isValid(Collection, Constraint...) with ContextSets.ALL as the active graphs.
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface ICValidator
        Parameters:
        theConstraints - the constraints to check. If no constraints are given, the defined constraints will be used.
        Returns:
        true if the constraints are violated, false otherwise
        Throws:
        StardogException - if there was an error while checking the validity of the data in the database

      • getConnection

        protected com.complexible.stardog.api.impl.AbstractConnection getConnection()
        Overrides:
        getConnection in class com.complexible.stardog.api.impl.DelegatingConnection

      • convertConstraint

        public String convertConstraint(Constraint theConstraint)
                         throws StardogException
        Returns the SPARQL query representation for the given constraint. Executing the resulting query will return an answer is the constraint is valid and will not return any results if it is violated.
        Specified by:
        convertConstraint in interface ICValidator
        Throws:
        StardogException

      • explain

        public StardogExplainer explain(Constraint... theConstraints)
                         throws StardogException
        Returns an explainer that can be used to explain the violation for given constraints. If no constraints are given then all the current constraints in the database are used.
        Specified by:
        explain in interface ICVConnection
        Throws:
        StardogException

      • addConstraints

        public IO addConstraints()
                  throws StardogException
        Return an IO which can add a constraint ontology specified in RDF to the database. Specifying the context in the IO object has no effect, you cannot put the integrity constraints into a specific named graph in the database.
        Specified by:
        addConstraints in interface ICVConnection
        Returns:
        an IO to use for adding the constraints
        Throws:
        StardogException - a handle to IO could not be obtained to add constraints

      • addConstraint

        public void addConstraint(Constraint... theConstraints)
                   throws StardogException
        Add the specified integrity constraint(s) to the database.
        Specified by:
        addConstraint in interface ICValidator
        Parameters:
        theConstraints - the IC(s) to add
        Throws:
        StardogException - the constraint could not be added

      • removeConstraints

        public IO removeConstraints()
                     throws StardogException
        Return a IO which can be used to remove constraints specified in RDF from the database. Specifying the context in the IO object has no effect, you cannot remove the integrity constraints from a specific named graph in the database.
        Specified by:
        removeConstraints in interface ICVConnection
        Returns:
        an IO to use for removing constraints
        Throws:
        StardogException - a handle to the IO could not be obtained to remove constraints

      • removeConstraint

                      throws StardogException
        Remove the specified integrity constraint(s) from the database
        Specified by:
        removeConstraint in interface ICValidator
        Parameters:
        theConstraints - the IC(s) to remove
        Throws:
        StardogException - the constraint could not be removed
